result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:13 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Phillip J. Violi.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - argument, Rebuttal argument by State; Ct binds case over; bail continued
Atty Phillip Violi for DE

Adjustment Number: 22A 035045,
Payable Number: 568666,
Receipt Number: 22RS029547,
Amount: $20.00
and returned.

State requests the bond conditions be amended to reflect that the DE not be in the 200 block of Cottage Grove Road, Madison WI, except to collect belongings with law enforcement. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDTIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.

- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin except only on direct military orders. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sarah N.
- Defendant shall not be in the 200 block of Cottage Grove Road, Madison, WI except to collect belongings with law enforcement.

Court reporter Teri Groves. State requests the bond conditions be amended to reflect that the DE not be in the 200 block of Cottage Grove Road, Madison WI, except to collect belongings with law enforcement. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDTIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

COurt reporter Teri Groves. Defendant appeared with an Attorney.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that the officer is not available for todays hearing. DE does not object to a setover. Court grants the set over request.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from SPD re: no attorney assigned
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin except only on direct military orders. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sarah N. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

03:41 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defense moved to dismiss Complaint, made argument. Court denied motion.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
